alert.note: Alert for Asotin; Garfield; Whitman (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 26 at 11:46PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM PDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southeast Washington, including the following counties, Asotin, Garfield and Whitman. * WHEN...Until 245 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways including Highway 12. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1146 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in Lick Creek Burn Scar. - Minor mud flows may be impacting roads around the Lick Creek Burn Scar. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Colton, Uniontown, Peola, Alder Thicket Campground, Wickiup Campground, Spruce Spring Campground and Misery Spring Campground. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.
